fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42349].
  {panel}

The ability to select the option to have all other steps go to a selected step is really nice.  However, those transitions created don't appear in the list of transitions for a step when you want to remove it.  

Consequently, the value dimishes if you cannot remove it from a step since, in our case, there is usually only one transition that is valid from a closed state (reopen).  Thus, I had to go into the properties for that created transition and basically hide it from everyone.  

I have several scenarios where this would come in handy and make creating some very complex workflows less time consuming when the user wants to go from one transition to any transition (e.g. project implementations are like this).  

Right now, I've not given them this option because of the time required to setup all these transitions. We just say, move it to Hold and from hold you can go anywhere - so, that is our workaround. 

Please consider having this option as a great default to quickly apply transitions; but, allow an admin to remove them individually, where appropriate.
fields.summary: Ability to remove a transition that is generated from the designer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42347].
  {panel}

See http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/changelog.html for details
Notably related to OFBIZ-5848 (Poodle) changes in Coyot
# support for TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 for APR connector. Based upon a patch by Marcel Šebek. This feature requires Tomcat Native library 1.1.32 or later. 
# Disable SSLv3 by default for JSSE based HTTPS connectors (BIO and NIO). The change also ensures that SSLv2 is disabled for these connectors although SSLv2 should already be disabled by default by the JRE. 
# Disable SSLv3 by default for the APR/native HTTPS connector.
fields.summary: Update embedded Tomcat to 7.0.58+
Allow drag and drop preference setting of workflow options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42344].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

In JIRA 6 it is not possible anymore to add new notification types easily by just registering  a new notification type using NotificationTypeManager.setSchemeTypes().
Actually it's possible to register a new type but later when notification events are processed one gets exceptions as in https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/183097. So in my opinion NotificationTypeManager.setSchemeTypes() is broken and that is why i file this as a Bug.

We understand Atlassians efforts to keep the core stable against misbehaving getRecipients() methods in customer implemented NotificationType's. I am also aware that uninstalled customer plugins cause problems in the core when they leave configuration information but hey, why not just log this as a simple warning and ignore it?
Now we have to use NotificationFilter - which still can be implemented badly and thus is not adding stability - *and* we are not able anymore to store the notification scheme entries in column notify_type of table notification. This requires to create code (UI,backend) to persist this information elsewhere.

There really should be an easier way to allow the definition of custom notification types, e.g. by switching back to the JIRA 5 behaviour when a certain system property is set on startup. As a big enterprise customer I am aware of what my notification type code does. I see your best intentions but this makes our life difficult since we need either to spend money to create new solutions for something we already have *or* change system classes. Both is not acceptable for us!

In the final it's even not clear to me for which technical reason notification types have been hard coded in JIRA 6. As a consequence Atlassian should have deprecated NotificationTypeManager.setSchemeTypes() already in JIRA 5 because it is broken now in JIRA 6. Also notification-event-types.xml should have been removed in JIRA 6. The way it is now developers still have the impression the extension mechanism works. 

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: Custom notification types broken in JIRA 6
Issue has been successfully created dialog does not appear for subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42339].
  {panel}

Relates to JRA-5447

Problem description:
If an issue is Closed with Resolution Reject or Won't fix, and has Fix Version set, it will be included in the Release Note for the Fix Version.
The problem is that Resolution is not shown in the Release Notes, only Status, making harder for the user to see that it is wrong. Example scenario: It can lead that the customer is informed in the release defecte is corrected in the release, but in reality it is not since it is rejected.

Proposed fix:
Transition to Reject/Won't Fix, should then empty Fix Version in post-function.
fields.summary: Transition to Reject/Won't Fix should empty Fix Version in post-function

Create unreviewed code/change workflow condition for Bitbucket reviews
User report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42328].
  {panel}

At the moment, if the users want to apply similar configuration on another instance, they need to do *Restore System*, which will not only restore the configuration, but also data (project, issues).

This would be useful to have a feature that allows customer to only migrate schemes to another instance.
- Workflow Scheme
- Permission scheme
- Notification scheme, etc

So in the case that the instances have different data, they can still apply the same schemes in both instances. For example, When the user wants to create a new project in another instance, the user could use the same schemes, instead of re-creating the new schemes and associated them with the projects, which will be time consuming.
fields.summary: Ability to only migrate JIRA schemes
tttt

fields.description:
*Constantly pops up an error*
!20150305174329001.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Individual Firefox users that are affected can increase the size of dom.storage.default_quota.  Details are available at [Accessing JIRA in the browser fails due to NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Accessing+JIRA+in+the+browser+fails+due+to+NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED]
fields.summary: Exception: NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED: Persistent storage maximum size reached

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42322].
  {panel}

We encountered situations, where the team was working towards finishing the next version / milestone. During that development phase, new issues (features / changes / bugs) were added to JIRA, but often the target version was forgotten to be defined for those issues.

It would be cool, if in the administrative view of a project, in the list of versions, one of the versions could be marked as "the default milestone" or similar - and after that, each new issue within this project automatically gets this version assigned as target version.

Still the user could manually remove this proposed target version - or replace it with a different milestone.

The use case would be, that there would basically be no issues anymore that are not assigned to a milestone (except it's manually chosen to be non targetet to a milestone).
fields.summary: Auto assign target version to new issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42320].
  {panel}

At the moment, this page will display all of the fields that are associate with a particular project.

You can find the page as follows:
<instance>/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa

It also may expose a critical internal information such as Issue Security Levels to the users that are not suppose to see it. Since security level are made to hide issues based on the user groupds, by showing the list of security levels in ShowConstantsHelp.jspa, may give internal information to the user. 

*The desired behaviour is to have a feature where user/administrator can hide or configure the content of ShowConstantsHelp.jspa*

h3. Workaround
Configure the create issues permission in your Permission Scheme to limit the number of users that can create an issue for particular project. 

If we have a project (let's called it Project A) that uses Issue Security Scheme A and Permission Scheme A, and has been set to only users in group A are able to create an issue for the project A, any users that are not belong to group A would not be able to create any issue for the project A. Hence, those users would not have the ability to search for the project during the issue creation screen, thus making the Issue Security levels for Issue Security Scheme A unavailable for them to see in ShowConstantsHelp.jspa as long as no project is using the same issue security scheme
fields.summary: Ability to hide or configure content of ShowConstantsHelp.jspa

Hi,

in the German version of Jira, I cannot time a task in March when clicking on the calendar. If I do it autofills for example 15/Mrz/15 while it expects 15/Mär/15
I then have to manually change to "Mär"

Please solve this.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42307].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA have been limiting "Bulk Edit" to only 1000 issues. While there might be a reason for the limitation such as it might able to impact the instance performance, there is no tool or other workaround to differentiate the previous edited 1000 issues if the issues that needs to be edited is more than 1000. While JIRA Admin able to make changes on the field to mark issues that have been edited, it will always be two steps operation:
# Bulk Edit and update fields to mark it while making the actually changes.
# Do another search with "!=" expression or JQL search that could differentiate it.
# Repeat.

These operation will take longer and major work to do if the issues need to be edited for example about 10,000, not to mention there could be a human error where the previous issues is included inside.

Hence, it would be great if there is a Tool or function that could segregated the 1000 issues out of 10,000 then runs automatically until those 10,000 issues is edited, rather than repeating the operation above again and again,
fields.summary: Automatically Edit 1000 Issues Continuously if Issues to be Edited is more than 1000

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42282].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When issuing requests to {{/jira/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projects.issuetypes}} on larger instances, in some cases the call can take over a minute to complete and generate 115mb of content.

With {{fields}} added ({{createmeta?projects.issuetypes.fields}}), JIRA can run out of memory if its Xmx is too low.
h3. Environment

The following data exists in the test instance:
{noformat}
Database Statistics
Issues          417547
Projects        1481
Custom Fields   1203
Workflows       324
Attachments     0
Comments        2921131
Users           17225
Groups          985

{noformat}
And 323 issue types.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup or use an instance with similar data sizes.
 # Query {{/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projects.issuetypes}}, for example [https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projects.issuetypes].

h3. Expected Results

The query returns in a reasonable timeframe.
h3. Actual Results

The query takes ~60 secs as per the attached screenshot, or in the case of {{createmeta?projects.issuetypes.fields}} runs out of memory entirely.
h3. Possible cause and room for improvement
h4. Duplicate content

We have seen that in some cases there are _logical duplicates_ in the {{optionconfiguration}} table. This, depending on the number of affected issue types, can cause performance issues itself. To check for such, you can run the following query:
{code}
SELECT fieldid,optionid,fieldconfig, count(*) FROM optionconfiguration group by fieldid,optionid,fieldconfig having count(*)>1
{code}
If the above returns any rows, you are likely affected by the problem. In this case, please raise a ticket on [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/], referring to this bug report and ask for assistance on de-duplicating the table.
h4. OOM

The only workaround for this behaviour is to increase JIRA's maximum heap. There's no hard-and-fast rule for what to increase it to, as it's a function of the number of projects, custom fields, issue types, and contexts for each.
fields.summary: On large instances the createmeta REST endpoint can take a very long amount of time to return results or cause JIRA to OOM

fields.summary: Blank Comment should not be added when attachments are created through email with no email body

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42227].
  {panel}

At the moment, accented characters are treated separately from normal characters when using a mention. This would be a problem if there are many users who use accented characters in their names.

An example would be as follow. Let's assume this instance have many users with the first name *Adam*, with different last names. It would be very hard to mention a person whose name is *Adam Lündy* since the mention only shows 5 results according to alphabetical order, and it is not as easy to type with accented characters.

!1.png|thumbnail!
!2.png|thumbnail!
!3.png|thumbnail!

By treating accented characters same as normal characters, then you can easily mention *Adam Lündy* by typing *@adam lu*
fields.summary: Allow @mention to treat accented characters (Féäther) as normal characters (Feather)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42225].
  {panel}

In JIRA, you are able to arrange Versions for a project. This affects what order the versions are shown in drop-down lists and also how 'version' type fields are sorted. 

The drop and drag functionality provided by the User Interface does not allow creating a version into a specific location, or automatically sorting this list using any criteria.

Projects with very long lists become difficult to manage. For example, imagine having many concurrent version releases being actively developed and needing to add a point release due to a security patch on each version. The Project Administrator would need to drag through the list all the new project versions to their correct locations.

Controls such as: Automatically Sorting the list by Version Number and allowing a user to define a specific "versionAfter" version when creating a new version would greatly aid in the usability of the product.
fields.summary: Managing and Sorting Versions needs better controls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42224].
  {panel}

When using the "Basic Search" feature, Issue Search is able to 'hide' fields which are irrelevant for the specified project. 

Within Advanced Search, it would be good if the Autocomplete feature could review the existing conditions defined in the JQL and hide or grey out fields that are irrelevant for the current search. 

One specific example is when a customer has many Custom Fields with the same name but different types within different projects. When the user attempts to use JQL in the Advanced search, Autocomplete suggests all the different fields with the same, and this makes the product difficult to use, even though a project has been defined within the JQL query.

Hiding fields which are not relevant to the current search context would make the product more user friendly.
fields.summary: Advanded Search Autocomplete filter suggestion based on existing search terms in Query

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42223].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When viewing an issue in JIRA, you are presented all the fields that are associated with a screen. I know you can display/hide fields by making a new screen and then associating with a workflow transition. However, I would also like this to reflect on the main page when viewing an issue.

h3. Example
An example would be on Create Issue you are presented with fields such as Zip Code, Phone Number, State and, City. So after creating the issue with these fields containing values, you will see these fields on the main page for viewing an issue. However, let's say I'm on a transition/status called "Shipped" and the screen for that transition does not contain the fields Zip Code, Phone, Number, State and City. I want that to be reflected on the main page thus hiding those fields.
fields.summary: Ability To Define/Set Field Visibility Based on Workflow Transition/Status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42215].
  {panel}

We'd like to be able to reference existing commits in Stash that introduced a bug, into the comments and description of the subsequent bug reports.

For example, we get a bug report, a developer looks at the commit history and finds the specific commit(s) where the bug was introduced and wants to discuss the commits with his colleagues. Right now he can type this by hand: {code}[73e778e|http://stash.example.com/stash/projects/PRJ/repos/project/commits/73e778ed40bf0384e7531712e9c92e08bb815472#src/main/webapp/app/controller/Controller.js]{code} to create a link like [73e778e|http://stash.example.com/stash/projects/PRJ/repos/project/commits/73e778ed40bf0384e7531712e9c92e08bb815472#src/main/webapp/app/controller/Controller.js]

We can already just type JIRA issue keys into comments and JIRa automatically transforms them into clickable links to those issues. It would be useful if we can just type 73e778e or 73e778e:src/main/webapp/app/controller/Controller.js and have JIRA automatically link it to the commit in Stash and even the specific file in that commit, respectively.

Perhaps with a different notation so that the parser can more easily pick it up as a commit id, something like #73e778e and #73e778e:<path> for specific files in that commit.
fields.summary: Allow linking Stash (git) commits by their SHA in JIRA comments and descriptions

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Secondly, I can see there is no Getting Help Support for JIRA Product and I manage to find the following pages:

Confluence - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Getting+Help+and+Support
Cloud - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Getting+help+and+support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42208].
  {panel}

Fluid.app could make a web based application to have a separate client or application rather than packed in one web browser.

Using Fluid.app it's a great help to be quickly able to switch between apps, without having to find the correct tab in whatever browser you happen to be using today. Rather than looking for the correct tab in web browser or have a lot of separate windows for each Atlassian Products, using this app we could just hit CMD+Tab a few times and we will be on where we want to be.

Using this app integration also could help to keep tracks on what we are working on.

So far, based on customers comment STASH and Confluence are working perfectly when integrated with the app, but not JIRA. It might have some problem in the cookie as logging out from the App would not work. Hence, it would be great if JIRA able to be integrated with this app or at least the cause of the log out problem.
fields.summary: JIRA to Support Fluid.app Integration
Can't move issues through workflow via mobile website or apps
Text overflowing in the User Profile page under German locale

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42201].
  {panel}

The New Project Navigation in JIRA does not provide an equivalent report to the classic *Project Issues Report*. This was a deliberate choice due to low usage of that page, and we've provided pre canned search filters in the "Issues" panel as well as more in-depth version data under "Releases".

Since then we've heard from a few customers they miss data which used to be available on that page. This issue is meant to collect your votes, as well as hear what specific use cases are not covered with the data available under "Issues" and "Releases".

!jira-browse_project-issues.png|thumbnail!
_classic project issues report_

*Workaround* 
You can create a custom dashboard with the Issue Statistic gadget to show the same information that was on the Issues report. Details on this are here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Accessing+the+Issues+summary+page+information+when+using+the+project+sidebar
fields.summary: I want to see an Issues report in the new Project Navigation menu

fields.description:

Hi,

We noticed 2 typos in the french version of Tempo:

Thanks

@Jacek Jaroczynski
fields.summary: French Typo in  Tempo (JIRA )

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42197].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Users would like the ability to set a default value in description fields. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to modify a template to set default values for issues.
 
h3. Workaround 
# Explained in this KB article: [Setting a Default Value in the Description Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+a+Default+Value+in+the+Description+Field].
This requires editing of server files, thus is not possible in JIRA Cloud.
# [Default Values Add-On|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.gebsun.plugins.jira.defaultvalues] (also not available for Cloud)
fields.summary: Ability to set a default description template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42196].
  {panel}

As stated in [JIRA text search documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-reserved], certain reserved words are treated by stop words by lucene and not included in the Search Indexes, making it impossible to search with them in the text search. e.g. a", "and", "are", "as", "at", "be", "but" and "by" to name a few. The idea of this is to avoid performance issues.

This becomes a major limitation in use cases where one of these words coincide with a string which represents an important search sting in a JIRA instance e.g. a code or acronym (for one customer BY is an IATA code which is a custom field value and used in the summaries of JIRA tickets as well). In this cases it's a major inconvenience and source of confusion for users who are not getting expected results when searching with this strings because they are treated as stop words by lucene.

Not sure what would be the best way to implement a solution for this problem, but perhaps we can implement a way to automatically modify the text to an exact search string by adding quotes automatically when a reserved word is used in search. e.g.:
basically {{text ~ "by"}} becomes {{text ~ "\"by\""}} automatically, so that the search doesn't fail.
fields.summary: Handling lucene reserved words in text search
Cannot paste (command + V) text on JIRA using Safari

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42193].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
There is no notification on the screen when comments are made, notification is being sent through email. 

*Feature Request*
Ability to show notification on screen rather than by email like what app does.

!Screen.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to show notification on screen when comment is added to an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42192].
  {panel}

When new users are logging in to JIRA, they will be redirected to:
- https://<instance name>/secure/WelcomeToJIRA.jspa

The page will keep refreshing and they are not able to do anything. It only affects Atlassian Cloud users (only some of them)

Update:
After 00:00am EST 25/02, it should have been fixed. If you still encounter this issue, please create a support ticket so that we can investigate further on it.
fields.summary: JIRA welcome page keeps redirecting for new users
REST API call /rest/api/2/password/policy/createUser and /rest/api/2/password/policy/updateUser has no documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42184].
  {panel}

To reproduce this problem:
1. Download any WAR distribution for the latest JIRA version (6.3.15).
2. Unzip the archive and open the README.
3. The links will all have this root path:
http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-${jira.docs.version}/

The ${jira.docs.version} part should have been replaced by the version number (e.g. 063).
fields.summary: WAR distribution README has broken links to CAC docs
Not able to see the content in my inbox after Cyanogen Update 11.0-XNPH05Q

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42182].
  {panel}

Our business users have found that is too hard for them to navigate thru a large number of issues because they cannot jump to pages efficiently.
The page control that allows users to pick a page shows only 5 pages, and if you want to jump to page 10 you have to click on the control 5 times, 
and everytime you have to scroll to the bottom to be able to click on the next set.If we increase the number of issues shown in each page, then the user
has to scroll even longer to reach the control.
Business users request that:
a) we move the page control to the top of the page, so that the number of issues per page can be increased without having to scroll more
b) we increase the number of pages to 21, so that you can move up or down 10 pages in one shot
When reviewing the java code we found that in the file:
jira-project\jira-components\jira-api\main\java\com\atlassian\jira\issue\search\SearchResults.java
the parameter that controls the limits in the page restriction is hardcoded to 5 pages:
private static final int PAGES_TO_LIST = 5;
We also see that in the pager control is created in the footer template:
jira-project/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/templates/jira/issue/table/issuetable-footer.vm
But it could have been easily added to the header template instead:
jira-project/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/resources/templates/jira/issue/table/issuetable-header.vm

Can you look at the above requests and determine if you could:
a) Allow users to configure in their preferences page the number of pages to be shown in the search result, similar to how it is already done for the number of issues per page?
b) Allow user to determine if the page navigator is shown in the footer or in the header of the search page?

We believe that the above improvement will help everyone.
Thank you for your help on this issue,
Reynaldo
fields.summary: Configure the restriction limit of the number of pages to list control shown at the bottom the Issue search result page
Centrally Manage Issue Links > Issue Link Schemes
Changing Project Lead Icon
Ability to view Bamboo builds and deployments in JIRA issue navigator
After issue is deleted move to next issue in list
Change Project Key Format for Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42172].
  {panel}

At the moment, in JIRA Services (g + g + Services), the only option available as of right now is to specify a delay.

As the users understand it, a service will run upon creation/modification of the service, and then run again (and again and so forth) every time $delay minutes have passed. Same goes for JIRA startup - run initially, and then again every time the delay has passed.

Contrast that with Confluence's "Scheduled Jobs", where, for at least some of them, it is possible to specify execution times like one does with Cron on *nix systems - in the case of the specific client I had in mind (who is not alone in this), it would be beneficial to specify, for instance 0 20 * * * for one service, 5 20 * * * for another, 10 20 * * * for a third etc., for execution every day at 20:00 for the first, 20:05 for the second, 20:10 for the third and so forth.

To summarise, the Cron-like ability for scheduling jobs in Confluence is great, and it would be very nice to have similar capabilities in JIRA.
fields.summary: Improvement for JIRA Services (following how Schedule Jobs works in Confluence)
Update 6.4 Stable to bundle Service Desk 2.3.0
Workflow View Screen - make transition screens visible
As an admin, I want to expire a user session immediately

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42167].
  {panel}

I am constantly doing various JQL searches in the issue navigator, and depending on what I'm searching for I have different preferences for which columns I want to view in the Issue Navigator. 
Such, as when I'm looking at outstanding defects, or outstanding requests, or looking at priority of request, etc. etc.  
It time consuming and annoying to constantly have to change the columns display.
For me I would like to save a few templates, that I could use for my various searches depending on what I'm searching for.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Power User I would like the ability to save different "List ViewTemplates" to switch between displayed columns in the  "List VIew" of the Issue Navigator more effeciently
Adding components to feedback is broken.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42165].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Entering a regex longer than 255 chars will throw an error in the JIRA log files, but there is no front end validation for the length of the mail handler regex

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA set up an Incoming Mail server
# Create a new Mail Handler of type _"Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"_
# Fill out the *Split Regex* field to be longer than 255 chars
# Click *add* and there will be an error in the JIRA log file

h3. Expected Results
If it is intended that JIRA does not accept more than 255 chars in the regex string an error on the UI should be thrown.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file:
{noformat}

This is because of how OvBiz works https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11075

h3.Workaround
There is no simple workaround for this bug unless:
* The regex is condensed down to 255 chars
* The AbstractPropertySet class is changed to accept over 255 chars (this is not supported by atlassian support however and would be done at your own risk).
fields.summary: JIRA Mail Handler field does not accept more than 255 chars
Customise when Link Issue is allowed
Configureable scope for "text" search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42161].
  {panel}

Customer is looking to show on Issue Pages, in the Time Tracking section, Negative Values on "Time Remaining" if they go over the Estimated Value.

For Example, Issue is estimated for 3 hours but work done is 4 hours; remaining time will show as 0 m:
!TimeTracking.png|thumbnail!. 

Customer would like to see this represented as -1 hrs on the Issue pages.
fields.summary: Show Negative Remaining Time on Issues for Going Over Estimates
Rename "Time to Resolution" field
Allow Customization Of Pie Chart Gadget Colors
Unable to Delete Projects Due to Attachments Not Found
